title: Russia, Iran and China intensifying life-threatening operations in UK, police say
Postman cut off girlfriend’s head after complaining she worked too much
Thousands of Afghans were moved to UK in secret scheme after data breach
description: The existence of the scheme could not be reported until now because of a court injunction.

title: I'm 'disappointed but not done' with Putin, Trump tells BBC
description: Trump says he trusts "almost nobody" in exclusive interview discussing the war in Ukraine, Nato and the UK.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: E.U. Nations Plan Retaliatory Tariffs Against Trump and U.S., but Would They Do It?
description: European Union officials have drawn up plans to impose levies on American imports, but questions abound about whether they would go through with them.
author: Jeanna Smialek

title: Police Arrest Far-Right Leader After Anti-Immigrant Riots in Spanish Town
description: Prosecutors said the local head of Deport Them Now, an anti-immigrant group, helped incite four days of violence that have rattled a town with a large North African community.
author: Lynsey Chutel and José Bautista

title: Why Prince Harry Is In Angola, Repeating Mother Diana's 1997 Trip
description: Prince Harry visited the African nation of Angola on Tuesday with a land mine clearing charity, repeating a famous trip his mother made in 1997.

title: Mike Waltz Vows To Make UN "Great Again" At Senate Confirmation Hearing
description: Mike Waltz painted an image for lawmakers Tuesday of what the United Nations would look like as the U.S. its largest donor reviews its support, opting to go "back to basics" under a Trump administration push to "make the U.N. great again."

title: Trump says Indonesia trade deal features 19% tariff; Jakarta yet to confirm
description: Trump in a Truth Social post called it "great deal, for everybody," and said it followed direct dealings with Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto.

title: Central banks are increasingly buying gold from local mines as prices surge
description: A growing number of central banks are buying domestically mined gold to build up reserves.

title: Attorney General Bondi brushes aside questions about her handling of Epstein files - NPR
description: Attorney General Bondi brushes aside questions about her handling of Epstein files  NPRAG Bondi says there’s no change to her position on Epstein after Trump suggests she could release more files  CNNWith Epstein conspiracy theories, Trump faces a crisis of his own making  AP NewsTrump offers MAGA a third option on Epstein  The HillLive updates: Trump says Bondi should release 'whatever she thinks is credible' on Epstein  NBC News

title: US House Speaker Johnson calls for 'transparency' on Epstein, in departure from Trump - BBC
description: US House Speaker Johnson calls for 'transparency' on Epstein, in departure from Trump  BBCSenate GOP needs Vance on recissions vote  PoliticoFor Some Republicans, Trump’s Shift on Epstein Is Just the Latest Breach  The New York TimesUS House speaker Mike Johnson calls for release of Epstein files amid backlash  The GuardianSpeaker Mike Johnson and other Republicans break with Trump on Epstein  The Washington Post

title: 'It's a delicate subject, but...': Trump aide Mike Johnson on release of Epstein files
description: US House Speaker Mike Johnson has urged the Justice Department to release all Jeffrey Epstein documents, a move that contrasts with ally Donald Trump's stance. This call follows criticism of Trump's administration for its handling of the case. House Republicans rejected a Democratic proposal to mandate the release of Epstein-related files.
author: TOI World Desk

title: 'Pretty boring stuff': Donald Trump downplays 'fascination' surrounding Epstein files; blames ‘bad people’ for keeping it alive
description: Donald Trump dismissed renewed interest in the Jeffrey Epstein case, deeming it "pretty boring stuff" and expressing confusion over his supporters' focus. Despite government findings, many in the MAGA movement remain unsatisfied, fueling conspiracy theories about high-profile figures connected to Epstein's alleged sex trafficking network.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Sudanese paramilitary RSF accused of killing almost 300 people in village raids
description: Rights group says targets of Rapid Support Forces in North Kordofan were ‘empty of military objectives’Sudan’s paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) have killed nearly 300 people in attacks in North Kordofan state that began on Saturday, according to Sudanese activists.The RSF has been fighting the Sudanese army in the area, one of the key frontlines of a civil war in Sudan that has raged since April 2023. Continue reading...
author: Carlos Mureithi in Nairobi and agencies

title: France signals willingness to discuss reparations for colonial massacres in Niger
description: Exclusive: French government says it is open to dialogue but does not acknowledge responsibility in letter seen by the Guardian More than a century after its troops burned villages and looted cultural artefacts in the quest to include Niger in its west African colonial portfolio, France has signalled willingness over possible restitution, but is yet to acknowledge responsibility.“France remains open to bilateral dialogue with the Nigerien authorities, as well as to any collaboration concerning provenance research or patrimonial cooperation,” the office of France’s permanent representative to the UN wrote in a document seen by the Guardian. Continue reading...
author: Eromo Egbejule in Abidjan

title: Trump plans to send migrants to ‘third countries.’ Others have tried that.
description: The U.S. policy echoes approaches tried in Australia, Britain and elsewhere.
author: Sammy Westfall

title: Nvidia says Trump administration lifts ban on AI chip sales to China
description: Washington has been concerned China could use Nvidia’s chips to get a jump on the U.S. in high-tech fields, particularly when it comes to artificial intelligence.
author: Katrina Northrop, Eva Dou
